history.text: The Wolf of Wall Street was such an epic movie. It is the retelling of how Jordan Belfort broke into the stockbroker business and became a huge disaster getting into drugs and portraying a glorified takedown of Wall Street from the inside.
I agree, it was so epic. Leonardo DiCaprio as Jordan Belfort gave a great performance.
Rotten Tomtoes only gave it an average 7.8 out of 10, I wonder what caused the lower score.
I'm guessing because some people didn't like the black dark comedy aspect of the movie.
Margot Robbie seems to handpick her roles, she did wonderfully as Naomi, almost as it was meant for it.
I absolutely agree. I would also commend Jonah Hill's role as Donnie Azoff; it was hilarious.
I think Mathew McConaghey was a little underplayed in this movie but it worked well.
Yeah I think he could have used more scenes in the movie. But regarding the movie's story; I enjoyed the FBI chasing and trying to bring Jordan Belfort down.
I think the FBI could have done a better job. I'm surprised Leo produced this and started in it.
It was also funny seeing famous director Rob Reiner play as Jordan Belfort's dad.
I wonder how Rothschild hired Mark Hanna. It was an interesting firm and concept.
Rothschild definitely had the knack for stockbroker culture with the sex and drugs.
1987 had to be a difficult time for some of these financial concepts.
Yeah, but Jordan still definitely found a way to make money.
It is scary to realize Black Monday wasn't that long ago!
Yeah I'm sure lots of people lost their jobs, just like Jordan, having to get a job with a brokerage that sells penny stocks.
I wonder why Jordan took to Donnie so well, they were neighbors but most don't interact.
I think Jordan liked being looked up to, respected.
I think it's part of how he was able to acquire so many young financiers.
Jordan liked to train in the art of a hard sell and it worked for him, even if it was sleazy.
He was no stranger to illegal tactics as well. In illegally making $22 million on Steve Madden's IPO
Forbes did a great and not so great job at writing their expose.
It's a wild plot, seeing as how the Swiss banker Saurel was arrested on a matter not related to Jordan, but ultimately caused Jordan's arrest.
I love how he was arrested on an unrelated charge and they made a great connection.
It was also a crazy scene where Jordan tries to runaway with his daughter but ends up crashing his car in the driveway.
I bet it was a lot of fun for the FBI to set up the raid on Stratton Oakmont.
Do you generally like dark comedies or movies by Scorsese?

Yes and the way this story played out and how Jordan ends up getting a reduced se
ntence made this one amazing.
Are you still there?

uid2response.feedback: It took very long for the document to progress, way longer than 3 turns.
